Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Enables the recognition and targeting of unfolded and aggregated proteins to the ClpC protease or to other proteins involved in proteolysis. Acts negatively in the development of competence by binding ComK and recruiting it to the ClpCP protease. When overexpressed, inhibits sporulation. Also involved in Spx degradation by ClpC.

BioProcess.Detail: The process in which a naturally transformable bacterium acquires the ability to take up exogenous DNA. This term should be applied only to naturally transformable bacteria, and should not be used in the context of artificially induced bacterial transformation.

The process in which a relatively unspecialized cell acquires the specialized features of a cellular spore, a cell form that can be used for dissemination, for survival of adverse conditions because of its heat and dessication resistance, and/or for reproduction.
BioProcess.Keyword: Sporulation resulting in formation of a cellular spore

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of sporulation.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of sporulation resulting in formation of a cellular spore

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of establishment of competence for transformation.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of establishment of competence for transformation
